metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 9 axioms covering ordered pairs, functions, and sequences with their operations
metadata.notation: First-order logic with mathematical structures for functions and sequences

axioms.title: Definition of pair0
axioms.english: Something is a pair if and only if it is an ordered pair of two elements

axioms.title: Pair elements structure
axioms.fol: (forall (p x y) (if (pair p x y) (and (first x p)(second y p))))
axioms.english: If p is the pair <x,y>, then x is the first element of p and y is the second element of p

axioms.title: Pair equality
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 x1 y1 p2 x2 y2) (if (or (pair p1 x1 y1)(pair p2 x2 y2)) (iff (equal p1 p2) (and (pair p1 x1 y1)(pair p2 x2 y2) (equal x1 x2)(equal y1 y2)))))
axioms.english: Two pairs are equal exactly when their first elements are equal and their second elements are equal

axioms.title: Pair uniqueness
axioms.fol: (forall (p x1 x2 y1 y2) (if (and (pair p x1 y1)(pair p x2 y2)) (and (equal x1 x2)(equal y1 y2))))
axioms.english: The first and second elements of a pair are unique

axioms.title: Definition of function0
axioms.fol: (forall (f s1 s2) (iff (function0 f s1 s2) (and (set s1)(set s2)(set f) (forall (p) (if (member p f) (exists (x y) (and (member x s1)(member y s2) (pair p x y))))) (forall (x) (if (member x s1) (exists (p) (and (member p f)(first x p))))) (forall (p1 p2 x) (if (and (first x p1)(first x p2) (member p1 f)(member p2 f)) (equal p1 p2))) (forall (y) (if (member y s2) (exists (p) (and (member p f)(second y p))))))))
axioms.english: A function f from set s1 onto set s2 is a set of pairs where each element of s1 occurs exactly once as first element, and every element of s2 occurs as second element of at least one pair

axioms.title: Function domain
axioms.fol: (forall (f s1 s2) (if (function0 f s1 s2)(domain s1 f)))
axioms.english: If f is a function from s1 to s2, then s1 is the domain of f

axioms.title: Function range
axioms.fol: (forall (f s1 s2) (if (function0 f s1 s2)(range s2 f)))
axioms.english: If f is a function from s1 to s2, then s2 is the range of f

axioms.title: Function mapping
axioms.fol: (forall (f x y) (iff (map f x y) (exists (s1 s2 p) (and (function0 f s1 s2)(member p f) (first x p)(second y p)))))
axioms.english: Function f maps x to y when the pair <x,y> is a member of f; f(x) = y

axioms.title: Skolem function correspondence
axioms.fol: (forall (y1 y x1 x e s1 s2) (if (and (skfct y1 y x1 x e)(typelt x s1)(rangeFd s2 y x e)) (exists (f) (and (function0 f s1 s2) (forall (p) (iff (pair p x1 y1)(member p f)))))))
axioms.english: When we have a Skolem function, we have a corresponding mathematical function

axioms.title: Definition of integer intervals
axioms.fol: (forall (s n1 n2) (iff (ints s n1 n2) (and (posInteger n1)(posInteger n2)(set s) (forall (n) (iff (member n s) (and (posInteger n)(leq n1 n)(leq n n2)))))))
axioms.english: s is the set of all positive integers from n1 to n2, including n1 and n2

axioms.title: Definition of sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (sequence s) (exists (s1 s2 n) (and (function0 s s1 s2)(ints s1 1 n)))))
axioms.english: A sequence of length n is a function whose domain is the first n positive integers

axioms.title: Definition of sequence length
axioms.fol: (forall (n s) (if (sequence s) (iff (length n s) (exists (s1 s2) (and (function0 s s1 s2)(ints s1 1 n))))))
axioms.english: The length of a sequence is the upper bound of its domain interval

axioms.title: nth element of sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (s n y) (if (sequence s) (iff (nth y n s)(map s n y))))
axioms.english: The nth element in a sequence is the entity that n is mapped to by the function

axioms.title: First element of sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (s y) (if (sequence s) (iff (first y s)(nth y 1 s))))
axioms.english: The first element of a sequence is the nth element where n is 1

axioms.title: Rest of sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (iff (rest s1 s) (and (sequence s)(sequence s1) (forall (i x) (iff (map s1 i x) (exists (j) (and (posInteger i)(successor j i) (map s j x))))))))
axioms.english: The rest of a sequence is the sequence that remains after the first element is removed

axioms.title: Last element of sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (s y n) (if (and (sequence s)(length n s)) (iff (last y s)(nth y n s))))
axioms.english: The last element of a sequence is the nth element where n is the length of the sequence

axioms.title: Element membership in sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (iff (inSeq x s) (exists (n) (nth x n s))))
axioms.english: An entity is in a sequence if it is the nth element of the sequence for some n

axioms.title: Before relation in sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (iff (beforeInSeq x y s) (exists (n1 n2) (and (sequence s)(nth x n1 s)(nth y n2 s) (lt n1 n2)))))
axioms.english: If one element's position n is less than another's, it is before the other in the sequence

axioms.title: Successive elements in sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 s) (iff (successiveElts x1 x2 s) (exists (n1 n2) (and (successor n2 n1)(nth x1 n1 s)(nth x2 n2 s)))))
axioms.english: Two elements are successive in a sequence if their positions are consecutive integers

conversion_notes.mathematical_structures: This chapter provides foundational mathematical structures (pairs, functions, sequences)
conversion_notes.function_theory: Complete function theory with domain, range, and mapping relations
conversion_notes.sequence_operations: Rich set of sequence operations including first, last, rest, nth element access
conversion_notes.integer_dependency: Sequences depend on positive integer theory (Chapter 13)
conversion_notes.skolem_connection: Axiom 9.9 connects logical skolem functions to mathematical functions
conversion_notes.overloaded_predicates: The 'first' predicate works for both pairs and sequences

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 9 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.mathematical_foundation: Provides mathematical structures needed for temporal and causal reasoning
